status_message: Agradecido por el increíble apoyo que ha recibido la campaña para dar voz a cada californiano. Poco más de $2.7 millones recaudados al 31 de diciembre. $2.7 millones excedieron nuestra meta por mucho. Gracias de todo corazón a todos los que hicieron esto posible.

Humbled by the incredible show of support for our campaign to give voice to every Californian. Just over $2.7 million raised by midnight on the 31st, far exceeding our goal. A heartfelt thank you to everyone who made it happen.

Thoughtful piece on fundraising from David Siders http://politi.co/2j5qqlS, but please consider giving to Los Angeles Mission at https://www.losangelesmission.org/give/ - it’s cold out there & people need our help.

Antes de comenzar sus celebraciones de Año Nuevo, ¿se tomaría un minuto para hacer una contribución en línea? Necesitamos menos de 28 contribuciones para llegar a nuestra meta. Contribuya ahora para colocarnos en la cima.

Con la elección de Donald Trump, es más importante que nunca. Es por eso que estamos trabajando hoy, y cada día, para construir una campaña que luche para que podamos proteger a nuestros residentes y nuestros valores. Por favor, contribuye con los que sea que pueda aportar.

According to the Council for Community & Economic Research, four of the ten most expensive places to live in the US are here in California. We need to do more to make sure that families can afford to stay and succeed in California.

-----------------------------

Según el Consejo para la Investigación Económica y de la Comunidad, cuatro de los diez lugares más caros para vivir en Estados Unidos están aquí en California. Debemos hacer más para que las familias puedan quedarse y salir adelante en California.
link_name: Most expensive places to live in the US, 2016

status_message:
The holiday season is a time to reflect and appreciate all your blessings. I am so grateful to everyone who has supported our campaign to give voice to every Californian. Our fundraising deadline is only 11 days away so I have to ask again for your support. Please take a moment to contribute to our campaign. 

-----------------------

La temporada de fiestas es tiempo de reflexión y de apreciar todas nuestras bendiciones. Estoy muy agradecido con todos los que han apoyado nuestra campaña para dar voz a cada californiano. Nuestro primer límite de contribuciones a la campaña es en sólo 11 días. Por favor, tómese un momento para contribuir a nuestro campaña.

status_message:
While Mayor, I wanted to bring economic investment into Los Angeles, which is why I supported a three-year holiday from business taxes for new businesses. As Governor, I want to take some of these commonsense policies statewide to make our state better for more people. #CaliforniaAllianceOfTaxpayerAdvocates

--------------

Durante mi alcaldía, quise traer inversión económica a Los Angeles, y por eso apoyé un receso de tres años sobre pago de impuestos a los nuevos negocios. Como gobernador, quiero usar algunas de estas políticas que tenemos en el estado para hacer de California un mejor lugar para más gente. #CaliforniaAllianceOfTaxpayerAdvocates

I'm proud to support the Para Los Niños Families organization and all the great work they are doing. I am honored to be a part of this event and having a great time with these wonderful families.

status_message: Con unas elecciones tan divididas y tiempos inciertos por venir, ahora más que nunca, necesitamos de este tiempo para reflexionar y dar gracias. Tengo mucho por lo que estas agradecido y se que juntos podemos enfrentar cualquier reto que venga. ¡Feliz día de Acción de Gracias!

With a divisive election and uncertain times ahead, now more than ever, we need this time to reflect and be thankful. I have much to be thankful for and know that together we can face any challenges ahead. Happy Thanksgiving!

Honored to have the opportunity to give back during this time of thanks. Thank you to the Los Angeles Mission for all the great work you do for our community and letting me be a part of it. #skidrowthanksgiving

link_name: NewsConference Villaraigosa, California and the New Adminstration

status_message: We have always been stronger when we integrate, not segregate. When we join hands and work together to solve our challenges. We can’t rip 11 million loyal Americans from the fabric of our nation without deporting more than people. We would be deporting our own American dream.

Siempre hemos sido más fuertes cuando integramos y no segregamos. Cuando nos unimos y trabajamos juntos para resolver nuestros retos. No se puede arrancar la esencia de 11 millones de Americanos y pretender deportar sólo personas. Estaríamos deportando nuestro suen?o Americano.

Mi campaña para gobernador de California se organiza alrededor de un objetivo poderoso – dar voz a cada californiano que quiere compartir una idea, inspiración o sueño para un mejor estado. Quiero unificar nuestro estado con soluciones y ayudar a reconstruir la clase media invirtiendo en nuestras escuelas y reparando la infraestructura de nuestro estado. También, quiero asegurarme que cada voz es escuchada, especialmente aquellas que han sido ignoradas u olvidadas. ¡Comparte tu voz en antonioforcalifornia.com!

My campaign for Governor of California is organized around a powerful goal – giving voice to every Californian who is moved to share an idea, an inspiration or a dream for a better state. I want to unite our state around solutions and help rebuild the middle class by investing in our schools and repairing our state’s infrastructure. And I want to make sure every voice is heard—especially, those who have been ignored or left behind. Share your voice at antonioforcalifornia.com!
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: Thank you to all the men and women who have served our country and sacrificed so much to protect our freedom. #VeteransDay

Nuestra nación eligió un nuevo presidente esta semana, y es ahora el tiempo exacto para recordar lo que siempre ha hecho grande a California. Sabemos que la respuesta al miedo es la esperanza, y la respuesta a la división es la unidad. 

Es por eso que estoy lanzando mi campaña para Gobernador. Quiero unificar nuestro estado con soluciones. Quiero ayudar a reconstruir la clase media invirtiendo en nuestras escuelas y reparando la infraestructura de nuestro estado. Y quiero asegurarme que cada voz sea escuchada, especialmente aquellas que han sido ignoradas u olvidadas. 

Nuestra campaña comienza hoy, y comienza contigo. Por favor, visita AntonioForCalifornia.com para compartir tu voz y tu visión de California.
link_name: Antonio por California
Antonio R. Villaraigosa
Antonio R. Villaraigosa's cover photo

status_message:
Our nation chose a new president this week, which is why this is exactly the time to remember what has always made California great. We know that the answer to fear is hope, and the answer to division is unity.
 
That’s why I’m launching my campaign for Governor. I want to unite our state around solutions. I want to help rebuild the middle class by investing in our schools and repairing our state’s infrastructure. And I want to make sure every voice is heard, especially those who have been ignored or left behind.
 
Our campaign begins today, and it begins with you. Please visit AntonioForCalifornia.com – to share your voice and your vision for California.
link_name: Antonio for California

status_message: Ready to unite. Ready to fight for what we believe. #buildingbridgesnotwalls

Polls are open for a few more hours here in California. Go out and vote! I waited in line for an hour today, but I urge those of you in line to not give up - stay in line and vote! I was proud to show my wife Patty what our democracy is about. It's not the negative rhetoric, it's about people standing in line, no matter what, to make sure that their voice is heard. #electionday Find your polling place here: http://www.sos.ca.gov/elections/polling-place/

Because of the diversity in the United States, we have grown and made our country stronger. status_message:
Celebremos la Independencia de nuestra nación complacidos, sabiendo que somos un faro de promesa, esperanza y libertad para muchos, en un mundo en el que abunda la tiranía y la opresión.

Debemos sentirnos orgullosos de que, el cimiento de nuestra patria sea la premisa " todos los hombres son iguales". Más orgullosos aún, de que, a pesar de que los Padres de nuestra nación no dijeron específicamente, mujeres, afroamericanos, indios nativos u otro europeo sin tierras, a través de nuestra historia nos hemos esforzado por lograr "una unión cada vez más perfecta", luchando para hacer realidad esa noción básica de la existencia humana.

 Nos convertimos en una "unión más perfecta" cuando la esclavitud fue abolida e incorporamos a nuestra Constitución,  la Enmienda 14 y después la Enmienda 19, que otorga a todos los ciudadanos igualdad ante la Ley y a las mujeres, el derecho al voto.

 Más tarde, el Acta de Derechos Civiles, el Acta sobre Derecho al Sufragio y el movimiento femenil, dieron un significado real a la  frase "todos los hombres" frente a la noción más limitada de nuestros antepasados y otorgaron más legitimidad a nuestra democracia.

La decisión de la Suprema Corte sobre la Igualdad ante el Matrimonio, representa un paso más hacia adelante, en lo que debe ser nuestra lucha constante por expandir la libertad y "la búsqueda de la felicidad" para todos.

Debemos, no obstante, celebrar nuestros progresos con vigorosa vigilancia, ante las amenazas a nuestra libertad. Los atroces asesinatos de nueve inocentes personas de color, en la iglesia "Mother Emanuel" A.M.E., son un recordatorio del odio racial y de la intolerancia  persistentes en muchos individuos. Los comentarios obtusos sobre los inmigrantes mexicanos, hechos por un bufón narcisista, candidato presidencial, deben ser confrontados, sin importar  quienes sean el blanco de esa retórica de odio.

En este día glorioso, mientras nos regocijamos por la fundación de nuestra Patria, no nos permitamos "dormir en nuestros laureles". ¡Nuestra lucha por crear "una unión más perfecta" no ha terminado!

 Para aquellos que dirían, en respuesta, "ama o abandona América", replicaríamos,  en este día maravilloso: "América, te amo y quiero que seas todo lo que nosotros aspiramos a ser"

 ¡Feliz cumpleaños América adorada!

 Antonio Villaraigosa

Let us celebrate our nation's independence reveling in the knowledge that we are a beacon of hope, promise and liberty to so many in  a world rife with tyranny and oppression.

We should be proud of our nation's founding on the premise that "all men are created equal". Prouder still, that although our nation's founding fathers did not mean women, blacks, Native Americans or other non-landowning Europeans. We have throughout our history strived to be " a more perfect union" struggling to realize that basic notion of human existence.

We became "a more perfect union" when we abolished slavery, passed the 14th Amendment and later the 19th Amendment to our Constitution  giving all our citizens equal protection under the law and women the right to vote.

Later the Civil Rights Act, the Voting Rights Acts and the women's movement gave real meaning to our forefather's limited notion of "all men" and gave our democracy more legitimacy.

The Supreme Court decision on marriage equality is another step forward in what must be a never ending quest to expand liberty and "the pursuit of happiness" for all.

We must however celebrate our progress with vigorous vigilance in the face of threats to our freedoms. The heinous murder of nine innocent black congregants  at  "Mother Emanuel " A.M.E. Church is a reminder of the residual racial hate and intolerance that still exists in too many.  The bigoted comments about Mexican immigrants by a narcissistic and buffoon-like presidential candidate, must be challenged regardless of who is the target of such hate speech.

So on this glorious day as we rejoice in our nation's founding let us not rest on our laurels, our struggle to create a "more perfect union" is still not done! 

To those who would say in response, " America love it or leave it" we say on this wonderful day, America I love you and want you to be all that we have held ourselves to be!

Happy Birthday my  beloved America!

Antonio Villaraigosa

Gracias por su valor al desafiar la negación inconstitucional de la libertad para todos. El derecho a contraer matrimonio es ahora la ley, en todo nuestro país. América sigue hacia adelante por el camino que nos conduce a una más perfecta unión.

Too many Californians are struggling to make ends meet, pay the bills, and send their kids to college. They are looking for progressive leaders in Washington who will fight for them, like Senator Boxer has done for over 20 years. I was honored to serve as Speaker of the CA Assembly and as Mayor of Los Angeles and it would be an honor to serve Californians again in the future. The urgency of the needs of the people of this great state have convinced me to seriously consider looking at running for California's open Senate seat.

Congratulations to LA's new Mayor, Eric Garcetti.  
 
Over his years as Council member for the 13th district and President of the Council, he's proven to be a true leader who will guide our City into its bright future.  I look forward to the inauguration and embarking on my own new journey. Tonight at midnight, we will toast both.

status_message:
Growing up in City Terrace, I didn't even know what City Hall was except the image on "Dragnet."  I never imagined I'd walk inside that building, much less be Mayor. This is the city where the impossible happens every day.  

I'm so grateful for everything Los Angeles has given me and honored to be able to give back.  

Thank you, LA, for allowing me the honor of serving as your Mayor for the past 8 years.

status_message:
Re: The Senate's passage of the immigration bill

Today marks a very significant step towards reimagining our broken immigration system into one that stimulates our economy and ensures that everyone plays by the same set of rules.

I applaud the hard work and consensus building demonstrated by the team of Senators who found common ground for the good of the country. And I'm happy the Senate has outlined a fair and achievable pathway to citizenship for the 11 million undocumented immigrants living in the shadows.  

We have a long way to go, and I urge the House of Representatives to stay in Washington, D.C. and pass the Senate's bill immediately.

Today, we have taken another momentous step on the path to full equality and dignity for all Californians and all Americans.  By striking down the Defense of Marriage Act, the Supreme Court has affirmed a basic American truth:  bigotry and bias have no place in our laws.  And with the Court's decision on Prop 8, California is poised to become the thirteenth state in America with full marriage equality. 

Today, we celebrate a victory for love and fairness, a victory for same-sex couples who only want to follow their hearts and marry the person they love.  As we move closer to a more perfect union, we will continue to make our case:  if we truly believe in family values, we should value all families.

status_message:
I am happy the City Council has approved my proposed budget which hands to the next administration a more financially secure City while restoring core City services.
 
I thank the Council for preserving a 10,000 officer Los Angeles Police Department and funding our innovative and highly effective Gang Reduction and Youth Development programs. I’m also grateful they agreed to increase services that are critical to the quality of life and well-being of our residents, including sidewalk repair, tree trimming, meals for the elderly, and graffiti removal.

Like all of you, I was disappointed by Congress' inability to pass commonsense gun legislation, but we will not let inaction in Washington stop us from taking action here in Los Angeles to get guns off of our streets. Thanks to my Gang Reduction and Youth Development Office, LAPD, and our community partners over 1,000 guns were removed from our streets this weekend alone. And thanks to the support our friends on City Council, the Gun Buyback program will continue beyond my term as Mayor.

status_message:
Today, Congress placed their bickering aside to successfully reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act.

The passage of this bill is more than just a bipartisan success. It is a reassurance to women across the country that no matter the economic climate, protecting their safety and the safety of all Americans is top priority. 

In Los Angeles, VAWA funding has helped expand the City's Domestic Abuse Response team, a collaborative crisis intervention effort between LAPD and victim advocates. 

Today’s vote continues the steps we took over two decades ago to reduce domestic violence and improve the treatment of rape and trafficking victims. This act is a reminder for countless women that they do not need to live in fear.

status_message:
Dr. Jerry Buss was a cornerstone of the Los Angeles sports community and his name will always be synonymous with his beloved Lakers. It was through his stewardship that the Lakers brought "Showtime" basketball and numerous
championship rings to this great City. 

Today we mourn the loss and celebrate the life of a man who helped shape the modern landscape of sports in LA, and my thoughts and prayers are with his family at this difficult time.

Now that the search for Christopher Dorner appears to have concluded, we are addressing the issue of the $1 million reward. More than 20 jurisdictions and entities are involved in this reward, so all of them will be coming together to collectively determine whether any individual or individuals qualify for it. Our personal hope is that the reward will be distributed, but we must follow the rules and respect the procedures of each entity.

I want to remind everyone to continue to be alert as long as this man remains at large. If you see Mr. Dorner or even suspect that you see him, please do not engage him. He is considered armed and extremely dangerous. Please report all information to the LAPD. You can find phone numbers below.
link_name: How to Submit a Crime Tip - official website of THE LOS ANGELES POLICE DEPARTMENT

status_message:
In Los Angeles, we’re making the tough choices to ensure Angelenos get the services they expect, while continuing to invest in our future. As a result, crime is at the lowest levels since the 1950’s, and we’re doubling the size of our rail network. As we look towards our budget for FY 2013-2014, we want your input. That’s why I’m pleased to announce the 2013 Los Angeles Budget Challenge is now available online.

The Los Angeles Budget Challenge was released February 1, 2013 and distributed to all 95 Neighborhood Councils around the City.  It is available for public access at http://la.budgetchallenge.org.  The survey includes questions focused on the City’s major budget concerns for the upcoming fiscal year and will be available online until March 4, 2013. Physical copies are due February 27.  Upon the deadline, my office will collect the information and release the findings to the public.

We hope that Angelenos will take full advantage of this opportunity.  This is your chance to help make the City work for you; your views are a vital aspect in creating a spending plan that truly reflects the needs of our city.
link_name: 2013 Los Angeles Budget Challenge

I'm saddened to hear of the death of my friend Huell Howser, a Los Angeles treasure and California icon.  

Although he was originally from Tennessee, Huell loved California more than most natives.  His long-running television program, California's Gold, shared with audiences the best our state has to offer.  Huell would travel anywhere to show viewers the beauty and variety of the Golden State, from its most famous landmarks to the least known sights.  And his boundless enthusiasm and curiosity was infectious, making us all see these places with the same amazement he did.  

His death is a loss that will be felt throughout Los Angeles and California.  He will be greatly missed.

status_message:
The quest for civil rights in the United States has been championed by extraordinary men and women. It has been our honor in the City of Los Angeles that extraordinary Civil Rights Leader, Willis Edwards, lived here, worked here and called Los Angeles home. Willis Edwards was a national leader for the NAACP and a partner with the City of Los Angeles in the struggle for equality and justice for all people. I was proud to call him a personal friend for over 20 years in the struggle for civil liberties. 
 
The legacy of Willis Edwards is that he made the impossible, possible; he fought the unjust for justice; he spoke boldly in the places of silence; and he stood tall and fearless as a leader when others cowered.  We are a better city, nation and world because of the excellence of Willis Edwards.
 
My thoughts and prayers are with his family during this difficult time.

status_message:
My statement on U.S. Supreme Court's Affordable Care Act decision:

“Today’s ruling by the Supreme Court to uphold the basic provisions of the Affordable Care Act is a historic step forward for our country. Healthcare for each and every individual is not a privilege; it’s a right. This morning’s decision is a victory for all Americans, and I could not be prouder.

By upholding the Affordable Care Act the Supreme Court ensured 3.1 million young people – including 435,000 young Californians – will maintain their coverage. The Court’s ruling protects Americans with preexisting conditions and provides them with access to the safe and secure healthcare options that were once out of reach. By ruling that those people who can afford to buy insurance have an obligation to do so, the Court has reaffirmed the bedrock principle of personal responsibility. And most importantly, the Court’s ruling moves our nation one step closer to the ultimate goal of providing healthcare for all. More than 30 million Americans will gain affordable health care with the enactment of this bill. This is a momentous achievement that should be rightly celebrated.

Despite today’s victory, our work is not done. America still spends more than any other nation for health insurance. The Affordable Care Act provides important protections to curb the skyrocketing cost of healthcare and lessen the impact on the nation’s budget. In fact, according to official estimates, the law will lower the federal deficit by $143 billion by 2019. It is now incumbent on our nation’s leaders to ensure the successful implementation of this bill. We must halt the opponents of progress who seek to “repeal and replace” this important step towards universal coverage.

I applaud the Supreme Court’s leadership and decision to put the American people ahead of partisan politics. Their ruling to uphold the Affordable Care Act reaffirms our country’s commitment to the health and financial security of our people.”

My statement regarding Congress reaching an agreement on a transportation bill that includes America Fast Forward: 

"America Fast Forward is a path-breaking program that will dramatically accelerate transportation projects across the country.

I applaud Congress for including America Fast Forward in the agreement to reauthorize the nation’s surface transportation programs. I specifically want to thank Majority Leader Reid, Chairman Boxer, Ranking Member Inhofe, Chairman Mica, and Ranking Member Rahall for their far-sighted leadership in crafting the agreement and moving forward with much-needed investments in our country's roads, bridges and rail lines.

The Surface Transportation Bill will preserve 2 million jobs. With the inclusion of America Fast Forward, it will put close to an additional million Americans to work.

Working in partnership with the US Conference of Mayors, we assembled a broad, bipartisan coalition, including nearly 200 mayors and both the AFL-CIO and the US Chamber of Commerce, to bring America Fast Forward to fruition.

America Fast Forward expands an existing program – the Transportation Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act (TIFIA) program – to give cities access to low-interest financing with flexible terms for their projects.

With America Fast Forward in place, cities across America will be able to speed up the construction of locally funded road and rail projects and get our economy moving again.

All of our proposals were included in the bill and we greatly appreciate Congress' support for these common-sense ideas.

Here in Los Angeles, this agreement on the Surface Transportation reauthorization and America Fast Forward will mean more jobs for Angelenos and will make it possible for us to accelerate our vision of a 21st century transportation network."

Antonio Villaraigosa on AZ Immigraiton Decision in Supreme Court
Antonio Villaraigosa on AZ Immigration Ruling in Supreme Court

status_message:
I am heartened by today’s Supreme Court decision to strike down key elements of Arizona’s controversial SB 1070. The Supreme Court rightly upheld the bedrock constitutional principle that the federal government alone has the power to regulate immigration. It is clear that the Obama Administration and the Department of Justice were right to challenge this law.
 
But today’s ruling must be seen as only a partial victory. The Supreme Court’s decision does allow Arizona to implement the law’s most problematic and potentially most harmful section: the ‘papers please’ provision.
 
By requiring police officers to demand documents of anyone they suspect of being in the country without authorization, Arizona risks creating a culture of fear and suspicion. Implementation of the law will undermine the trust between the police and the public, driving a wedge between police officers and the community they serve. The papers please provision opens the door for racial profiling, and I believe it will be impossible to implement this law without discrimination. This will just invite further litigation.
 
In today’s decision, the Supreme Court rightly drew attention to the lasting contributions that immigrants have made to this country. We need a sensible and humane national immigration policy. We do not need a confusing patchwork of 50 state laws. It is time for Congress to act. It is time to pass the DREAM ACT and it is time to enact comprehensive immigration reform. We need a national solution to this national challenge.

My statement in response to President Obama’s action to end deportation of young immigrants:

“By ending the deportation of certain young immigrants and making them eligible to work in this country, President Obama has taken a bold step in the direction of a more humane and more sensible immigration policy. His action today upholds some of America’s most cherished values: our belief in opportunity and fairness and our tradition of openness and inclusion. Crucially with his decision, the President has also protected young immigrants, many of whom have been here since they were infants and have spent their whole lives in this country. Instead of fearing deportation, instead of facing the prospect of being separated from their loved ones, hundreds of thousands of young people can now do what generations of their predecessors have done. They can contribute their energy and enthusiasm and their dreams and determination to their new home and help drive the future prosperity and growth of the United States.

After an extended and frustrating impasse in our national immigration debate, President Obama has led the way and pointed us in the right direction. But this is only a first step and much still needs to be done. Now it is up to Congress. Let’s expand the circle of opportunity even more and finally pass the DREAM ACT. Let’s finally achieve comprehensive immigration reform.”
I love LA.

status_message: As part of a year-long campaign road trip, California gubernatorial candidate John Chiang will make a four-day road trip through California July 1st -July 4th. He will begin his trip in San Diego County, and continue onto several stops that will include Bakersfield and Fresno on Sunday, July 2nd, 2017. Along the way, Chiang will receive a key endorsement and conclude his trip in Alameda County on July 4th participating in the annual Alameda County Fourth of July Parade.

status_message: This Juneteenth, we honor a 152-year-old celebration marking the end of slavery. While the Emancipation Proclamation went into effect in 1863 slaves in Galveston Bay, Texas had no idea they were free. It wasn’t until June 19, 1865, that chattel slavery finally ended, and the Reconstruction Era started.

status_message: Join us on Facebook Live tomorrow morning at 9:00 AM from Presidio Park for the San Francisco launch of my tour of California! Together we can take a different road for California.#JoinJohn

I remember growing up as the first Asians on our block we were discriminated against. We may have faced hatred in our past—we may face it even today, but we fight so that no one else ever must face it again. #Persist #JoinJohn

As we get ready to get on the road again, like that Willie Nelson song, I'm excited we get to do it in style with our own camper made by the The Happier Camper, a small, burgeoning company in the Los Angeles community of AtwaterVillage. It is modeled on the lightweight fiberglass trailers of the 1950’s and 1960’s which used California aerospace manufacturing techniques to bring unprecedented mobility to American families.  Back then they turned Americans loose to discover the nation. We just want to rediscover #California. Will you #JoinJohn. Let's take a different road.

status_message: Happy Cinco de Mayo as we not only commemorate the Mexican Army's unlikely victory over French forces at the Battle of Puebla on May 5, 1862, but we also honor and celebrate  our country and state's rich and beautiful Mexican-American culture!

Today, we witnessed a vote that has begun the process of dismantling the Affordable Care Act.  This is heinous and not the world that I want to live in.  House Republicans want to replace and deface the ACA--- I want to improve and embrace it.  I know you do too, and together we will.  That’s why I support SB 562, the Healthy California Act, making sure that California has an alternative and takes a different road.
link_name: California shows why the Republican plan to rely on states to replace Obamacare may not work

status_message: While I am deeply disappointed in the most recent example of the typical Beltway deal making with the passage of HJR 66, favoring Wall Street bankers over Main Street workers, I am more resolute than ever to standing-up Secure Choice so all Californians can have a dignified retirement. While Congress has dealt Californians a set-back, I've consulted with legislative leaders and the Office of the Attorney General, and I'm convinced that it's not enough to push us off of our moral and legal high ground.

Wells Fargo and Wall Street shouldn’t be able to defraud customers, and if they do, they certainly should NOT be allowed to force arbitration to secretly settle the legal disputes.  That’s why today I announced Senate Bill 33, legislation that would allow victims to sue in California state courts by allowing judges to deny petitions for binding arbitration in cases involving fraud.
link_name: Legislation introduced to address Wells Fargo scandal

status_message:
At a time when the White House is rolling back consumer and investor protections, California must lead in the fight against deceptive marketing, discriminatory lending, unnecessary fees, illegal kickbacks, and other abusive banking practices.  That’s why today I announced Senate Bill 33, legislation that would allow victims to sue in California state courts by allowing judges to deny petitions for binding arbitration in cases involving fraud.

 I have your back and always will.

On May Day, we recognize and stand in solidarity with those who have spent tireless days and sleepless nights building this country from the ground up.  My parents showed me that against all odds, the American Dream is attainable. On this #MayDay, we stand with the laborers and the middle class in support of fair wages and equal opportunity.

Our children's education is at the forefront of the future success of this state and country. It was an honor to collaborate with other state leaders today. With Chesterfield County School Board Chair Javaid Siddiqi, Wyoming Secretary of State Ed Murray, Hawaii Attorney General Doug Chin and former Colorado Treasurer Cary Kennedy.

As we celebrate International Women’s Day I can’t help but think that a “day without women", would be a day without pioneers.  It would be a day without women that have inspired movements and influenced every aspect of American life. 

What would a day look like without American civil rights activists, like Rosa Parks  or the first Latina, Sonia Sotomayor to serve in the highest court in the land? These leaders are shining examples of why it’s important to stand up for freedom, justice and women.

status_message:
We know California’s infrastructure is crumbling. And the recent Oroville Dam crisis is proof. Not only did it force nearly 200,000 people to evacuate, but fixing the dam’s spillway comes with a $200 million pricetag. 

There are hundreds of bridges, dams, levees, roadways, and other critical public infrastructure that are in disrepair.  Rather than wait for them to collapse or fail before we react, I have a plan for a more proactive, financially-responsible approach.  And most importantly, it's an approach that better protects life and property.

Read more about my detailed plan here.
link_name: bit.ly

status_message:
Blocking a thoughtful retirement-savings idea-especially one that that denies more people to live with dignity in their retirement years — would be a colossal mistake! And as the person who oversees our Secure Choice Program, I won’t let this happen. Not on my watch.

That’s why I’m fighting with Republican forces in charge in Washington.  Want to join me in fighting back against Wall Street and protect the hard-earned dollars of millions of Californians? 
  
Then sign this petition to tell Congress to keep their hands off: Congress should leave a sensible and workable retirement plan alone.  

California should be allowed to innovate on behalf of its workers and not be ruled by Wall Street worried about competition!
link_name: Protect Secure Choice and tell Congress to put people first NOT Wall St.

status_message:
One of the first civics lessons taught to immigrants seeking citizenship is the President is neither a king nor a tyrant.  He cannot govern by decree.  Instead, the commander-in-chief is held in check by co-equal branches of government and the Constitution.  

Today's ruling by the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals hammers home that most basic cornerstone of American democracy.  

This 3-0 ruling properly repudiated Trump's Muslim ban as unconstitutional.  His ill-conceived policy neither makes the country safer from terrorism nor respects those core values which truly make America great:  equality, fair play, and the  promise that the United States is a welcoming place for those “yearning to be free."

Check out why Speaker Rendon's endorsement matters: 
http://www.foxandhoundsdaily.com/2017/02/rendon-endorsement-chiang-matters/

It's shameful that Congressional Republicans are bowing to Wall Street interests so they can make a buck on the back of Main Street workers who are trying to do their best to save for retirement.

Secure Choice, has been hailed as the most significant change to retirement since the passage of Social Security in 1935.  Over 6.8 millions Californians rely on Secure Choice for a dignified retirement.  And now that effort is now under siege.

I’m thrilled to announce the endorsement from one of the state’s most prominent progressive voices, Speaker Anthony Rendon!  Speaker Rendon has continuously fought to improve the lives of all Californians regardless of their income or where they live:

“I have known and worked with John Chiang for over a decade, he is a creative progressive leader who offers real solutions to California’s difficult problems. John will stand up to the intolerant and irresponsible agenda of the Trump Administration and lead California down a different road, to a future of respect and opportunity for all. John Chiang will be an outstanding Governor, and I am proud to ask Californians to join me in supporting him.”
As a leader in the financial marketplace, I cannot stand by and let this happen again. I will fight to preserve #DoddFrank and other financial protections. Read: http://bit.ly/2jUFgfK

status_message: As Americans -we cherish our constitutional rights.  How we govern and to be governed have clearly been set forth in our Constitution.  I applaud the federal judge’s ruling on the President’s executive order on the immigration ban. As Governor of California, the safety and security of all Californians will be a top priority. Many of us have known first hand violence and its’ terrible impact. As horrible as that violence may be- it should never be a catalyst to give into fear, to demagogue against others, to paint with broad swath large parts of our society as targets for discrimination.  I  also urged the president to repeal his executive order and seek solution within boundaries of our Constitution.

status_message:
What you don't know will cost you!  Helping people with their economic struggles has always been my passion.  Too many people do the right thing, they work hard, and still struggle to make ends meet.  

While serving on the Board of Equalization and as California's Controller, I offered free income tax preparation as a Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) center. 

VITA helps thousands of California families receive tax refunds to help ease their stress and empowers families to put money back in their pocket.  If you know someone who makes less than $54,000, please let them know they can get free tax help- BOE members provide free tax assistance . 

I am grateful this program continues under the leadership of the BOE members. That’s why I’m running for Governor, to build a road to a better future by strengthening our communities with tools they need to live better lives.https://www.boe.ca.gov/freetaxhelp/

status_message:
I applaud Governor Brown’s 2017-2018 budget proposal for focusing on paying down debt and building up budgetary reserves in preparation for the next economic downturn and upheavals that will come from the change in federal administration.

If it is true that budgets are a reflection of our values, then let’s embrace a plan that uplifts our people, promotes job creation, and focuses on building infrastructure for generations of Californians. A budget that provides hope in these uncertain days following one of the strangest and most divisive presidential elections in memory.

 It must also serve as a counter-point to a Trump presidency that denies the science underlying climate change, threatens to leave millions of Californians without vital healthcare access, defunds preventative and family planning services to low-income women, and undermines working families.

Let's stand with Planned Parenthood, to fight for the principle that women deserve high quality health care!  As part of their effort to eagerly scrap President Obama’s Affordable Care Act, Republicans have announced their plan to DEFUND Planned Parenthood, which serves as one of the largest preventive healthcare providers for over 55 million women.  An attack on Planned Parenthood is an attack on women’s health!
http://www.sacbee.com/opinion/op-ed/soapbox/article123489024.html

status_message:
While yesterday was hard for many of us, I look around the state of California and see hope. I continue to be inspired by the ideals that Californians hold close to their hearts: the rule of law, religious freedom, equal rights, tolerance and economic prosperity for all.

Now more than ever I am determined to be your next Governor, a Governor who will fight for our values. We have seen how polling and preparation can slip through our fingers, so I am asking you to join me now. Commit to the future of our state now. 

We may have lost yesterday, but we must not be defeated. Together, we must channel this result into motivation to fight even harder for our future. As Secretary Clinton so rightfully stated, "Please never stop believing that fighting for what's right is worth it."

status_message: Please join me at the Solano County Small Business Tax and Regional Opportunities Seminar on Tuesday, October 25, from 1-4 p.m.  I am proud to be co-sponsoring this event with State Senator Lois Wolk and the City of Vacaville.

Reminder!  Inland Empire Restaurant Seminar in Chino Hills this Wednesday, October 19, 2011, from 2:00 – 5:00 p.m.  Hosted by Assemblymember Curt Hagman, San Bernardino County Supervisor Gary Ovitt, Chino Hills Mayor Ed Graham and my office.

Assemblymember Curt Hagman, San Bernardino County Supervisor Gary Ovitt, Chino Hills Mayor Ed Graham and I are hosting the Inland Empire Restaurant Seminar in Chino Hills on Wednesday, October 19, 2011 from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM.  Representatives from the U.S. Small Business Administration, Franchise Tax Board, San Bernardino County Department of Public Health, my office, and many others will provide valuable information and resources to assist restaurant owners, staff and interested parties.   Registration begins at 1:30 p.m. at  the Chino Hills City Council Chambers.
Tax season is coming! Over the weekend, my staff trained over 40 volunteers on how to provide free tax preparation to California residents. More trainings to come!

Assemblymember Manuel Perez and I are co-hosting the Western Coachella Valley Small Business Tax Seminar in Desert Hot Springs this morning.  If you are interested, please join us at the Mission Lakes Country Club at 8:30 am.

This settlement is a significant victory for insurance policyholders.  Under my unclaimed property authority and after three years of work, my office and John Hancock have come to agreement to reunite $20 million with their rightful owner.
link_name: State controller reaches settlement with insurer John Hancock

status_message: I am speaking to the Contra Costa Council, East Bay Economic Development Alliance and Jobs and Housing Coalition this morning about the impact of interest rates, unemployment, gas prices, international trade and health care inflation on California's economy and budget.
I will attend the 2011 Baisakhi celebration this morning.  There is no place for the ignorance, discrimination and hate that the Sikh community experiences.
I am reading 1,252 pages of briefing materials for the April CalSTRS meetings this week.  CalSTRS is one of the nearly eighty boards I serve on as Controller.
I am joining Teddy Zee, William Wang, Charlie Woo and Stewart Kwoh at the C100 Leadership and Mentor Program this morning.  It is exciting to work with our next generation of leaders.

link_name: State Finances 101: Bookmark This Now!

status_message: As Chair of the Franchise Tax Board, I want Californians to know about a program called ReadyReturn.   ReadyReturn provides many of the state's taxpayers with a filled-in or completed tax return that is ready for their review and ready to e-file - all for free.  To check, go to ftb.ca.gov and click on ReadyReturn.
Thank you to Legal Momentum, The Women's Legal Defense and Education Fund for honoring me as the inaugural recepient of the Men of Distinction Award.

I am starting the day with a 5:15 am radio interview on KGO (Bay Area) to discuss California's cash position and revenues and disbursements in February.  A copy of my monthly report can be found at www.sco.ca.gov.

My office is partnering once again with KABC in Southern California to help reunite property owners with their lost property.  Viewers can call in to the number posted during the evening news.  One can also go to www.claimit.ca.gov.
Later today, I will deliver the keynote address at the National Association of Women Business Owners Policy Summit where I will discuss what is required to keep California globally competititive.

This morning I am visiting Toyota Headquarters to get an update on advances in fuel cell technology and to speak to the employees about clean technology and the economy.  In America, we spend - on average - more than $1000 for every child, woman and man on imported oil.
I look forward to attending the Young Storytellers Foundation's fundraiser tonight.  The charity supports arts education in underserved, arts-poor public schools in the greater Los Angeles area.

Congratulations to the Honorable Ted Lieu, my state senator, on the occasion of his district swearing-in ceremony.  Ted deserves recognition for his work to highlight and end unscrupulous financial practices.

My office provides free income tax preparation for low income families. This week, we are assisting Californians in Merced, Stockton, Long Beach, Antioch, La Puente, San Francisco, Compton, Oakland and Burbank.  Please call my office to schedule an appointment.
Thank you to the Association of Government Accountants for honoring me with the William R. Snodgrass Distinguished Leadership Award for "leadership in meeting the challenges of a global recession."

link_name: More government pay data released in the wake of the Bell scandal

status_message: This morning, I am speaking to two classes of fifth grade students at Towers Elementary School which is having their annual career day.

After speaking yesterday in Riverside at the US/Mexico Sister Cities national convention about the international implications of California's fiscal situation, I am heading back out to Riverside County this morning to speak about the economy and state budget.

Ric Romero and KABC-TV put together a great program last night about unclaimed property.  For three hours solid, my staff and I were excited to take calls and answer questions from viewers hoping to be reunited with lost property.

I am honored to be able to administer the oath of office to Assemblymember Warren T. Furutani at his swearing-in ceremony this afternoon.  Warren is a tireless worker and a passionate advocate for education and civil rights.

Thank you to the public servants at Secretary of State Debra Bowen's office for your kind words earlier today.  I am deeply affected by a comment one worker made that my work saved her and her husband.
My thanks to the Los Angeles County Bar Association Business and Corporations Law Section for honoring me with the Marvin Greene Award tonight.
This morning, I am speaking about California's cash condition at Governor-elect Brown's budget briefing for educators.
This afternoon, we honor Shirley Roberts, a passionate voice for justice.  She passed away last Tuesday.
Thank you to the volunteers - over 100 - who are being trained today by my staff to provide free income tax assistance to working families.
